intro: Cordia brevispicata, commonly known as the short-spined cordia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Cordia brevispicata is often found in dry to semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
